TopicTitle: what version of the game did you download first?

Articles.Content:
I first bought the game in version .16

EDIT: I meant bought and I thought .14 was the first paid version.

Edited July 27, 2013 by duncan1297
I downloaded 0.13, which was the only "demo", but I bought 0.18.2.
Downloaded 0.8.4, bought around 0.13 or 0.14. There have been quite a lot of change since then.
Wow, you guys responded fast.
Umm I bought the game before the Mun was released, so it must have been around 0.12? The game was $7 or so at the time. Best $7 I've ever spent.

"Back in my day, the only thing you could do was orbit Kerbin and the only way you could tell if you were in orbit was by waiting an hour to see if you fell back down!"

Ah, those were the days. But seriously, the game has come a long way since then. There's so much more to do now xD

First discovered the game in 0.8, bought it as soon as it started costing money.

0.8.5

Bought the game as soon as we could, for 7$
.17 is when I first bought it
0.13 why is 0.14 the earliest version allowed? you should go back to 0.7
I thought .14 was the first paid version

A new player, .20 is my first and (hopefully not for long) only version.

I look at the poll results and I feel so alone. ;n;
I bought KSP version 0.16.0
i played the demo of 0.13.3 then i bought it as soon as 0.17.0 came out
0.18 for me and my first day with the "full" game was spent trying to figure out where the launch tower, which was in the demo, had wandered off to.

I started playing around 0.8, but once the paid versions came out I kind of stopped playing for some reason. Then I remembered that this game exists and is awesome, and I bought it around 0.18. It was some crazy culture shock.

I started playing around version .08 or .1 something around there (no mun, no map, no timewarp)

stopped for awhile because of school but then saw what i missed out on and bought the game on the same day .15 released (didnt know that at the time )

I think I got it around .16. From what I can remember, there was no ASAS; only SAS. I gave up trying to get a simple rocket into orbit.

Youtube got me back into KSP. Got the 0.20.2 version.
My signature tells it all - back in the days where achieving orbit is already a huge achievement.
I downloaded the 0.13.3 demo, then bought the full game in 0.17
Needs to add a new option: Before 0.14
I downloaded .13.3, and bought it a few days after .14 came out.
I've been playing since 0.8.3, the day HarvesteR posted it on orbiter-forum.
I downloaded the demo shortly after the PC Gamer did and article on KSP (witch was the first time I ever heard of the game). Bought the full version the next day, so I think that 0.18?

I downloaded 0.13, which was the only "demo", but I bought 0.18.2.

1234567890
